title: 4 simple habits everyone should adopt for clean and white teeth - The Times of India
summary:
4 Simple Habits Everyone Should Adopt for Clean and White Teeth

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

This article discusses simple Ayurvedic habits that promote dental hygiene and help maintain clean, white teeth naturally, highlighting their health benefits.

  • Clean, white teeth contribute to overall health.
  • The WHO estimates 3.5 billion people suffer from dental diseases.
  • Adopting Ayurvedic techniques can reduce the need for harsh chemicals in dental care.
  • Four key habits are recommended for effective dental hygiene.
"Ayurveda gives simple, natural therapies to keep teeth and gums healthy."

Incorporating these habits into daily routines can significantly enhance oral health without relying on conventional dental products.
newTitle: 4 Simple Habits for Clean and White Teeth

title: Jagmeet Singh Joins Calls For Trudeau’s Resignation Amid Deputy’s Exit, Cites Trump Tariff Threat - News18
summary:
Jagmeet Singh Calls for Trudeau’s Resignation Amid Political Crisis

Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: News18

Jagmeet Singh, the leader of Canada’s New Democratic Party, has joined renewed calls for Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to resign, citing high living costs and the looming threat of tariffs from US President-elect Donald Trump.

  • Singh stated, "Today, I am calling on Justin Trudeau to resign. Liberals are fighting themselves when Canadians need a Prime Minister who will fight for them."
  • Trudeau is facing significant political challenges following the unexpected resignation of Deputy Prime Minister Chrystia Freeland, which has led to a third of the Liberal MPs demanding a leadership change.
  • Reports indicate that nearly 60 of the 153 Liberal MPs in the House of Commons are rebelling against Trudeau's leadership.
  • Trudeau is trailing Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre by 20 points in recent polls.
  • Freeland’s resignation letter referred to a “grave challenge” for Canada, linked to Trump's proposed tariffs on Canadian goods.
“Today, I am calling on Justin Trudeau to resign. Liberals are fighting themselves – when Canadians need a Prime Minister who will fight for them.” – Jagmeet Singh

This political turmoil comes as Trudeau's government grapples with internal dissent and significant external pressures, which may have lasting implications for Canadian politics.
newTitle: Jagmeet Singh Calls for Trudeau’s Resignation Amid Political Crisis

title: Shatrughan Slams Mukesh Khanna Over Sonakshi-Ramayan Row: 'Who Appointed Him Guardian Of Hindu?' | Viral - News18

  • Sonakshi Sinha confronted Mukesh Khanna after he remarked on her forgetting a detail about Ramayan on Kaun Banega Crorepati.
  • Shatrughan Sinha questioned Mukesh Khanna's authority to judge and labeled him 'guardian of the Hindu religion'.
  • Shatrughan emphasized that forgetting a question about the Ramayan does not undermine Sonakshi's identity as a Hindu.
“Not answering a question on the Ramayan doesn’t disqualify Sonakshi from being a good Hindu.” - Shatrughan Sinha

Shatrughan Sinha expressed pride in his children, affirming Sonakshi's accomplishments and dismissing the need for validation through religious trivia.

summary:
'Why Would I Live Separately Then?': Atul Subhash's Wife Nikita Singhania On Harassment Allegations

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: News18

Nikita Singhania, estranged wife of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash, denied allegations of harassment during police questioning, asserting she had lived separately from Atul for nearly three years.

  • Nikita was arrested in connection with the suicide case of her ex-husband Atul Subhash.
  • She claims Atul was the one who harassed her, contradicting his allegations.
  • Atul had written a suicide note citing family troubles and persecution, including financial demands from Nikita's family.
  • Atul's family expressed disappointment over perceived bias in favor of women in the legal system.
  • Atul was 34 years old at the time of his death, which followed numerous domestic and legal conflicts.
“Justice is due,” Atul wrote in his suicide note, which was found with 24 pages detailing his grievances.

This case has stirred significant conversation around domestic abuse laws and their application in society, with attention on the emotional and psychological impacts of such allegations.

title: Study finds taxi and ambulance drivers less likely to die from Alzheimer's disease - The Times of India
summary:
Study finds taxi and ambulance drivers less likely to die from Alzheimer's disease

Publication Date: Not specified Source: British Medical Journal

A new study has revealed that deaths from Alzheimer’s disease are significantly lower among taxi and ambulance drivers. These professions may provide a protective effect against Alzheimer's disease, which impairs memory and thinking.

  • Researchers from Massachusetts General Hospital analyzed death data from nearly nine million individuals across 443 occupations.
  • Only about 1% of taxi drivers (171 individuals) died from Alzheimer’s, and 0.74% of ambulance drivers (10 of 1,348) were affected.
  • Taxi and ambulance drivers had the lowest rates of Alzheimer’s-related deaths compared to the general population and other occupations.
  • This protective trend was not observed in other transport-related jobs.
“This trend highlights a potential link between spatial tasks and reduced risk of this neurodegenerative disease.”

The findings suggest that engaging in spatial and navigational tasks may lower the risk of developing Alzheimer’s disease. Maintaining a healthy lifestyle and staying mentally active can help reduce risk.
newTitle: Study finds taxi and ambulance drivers less likely to die from Alzheimer's disease

title: ‘BJP Ended One Nation, Two Constitutions’: JP Nadda On J&K During Rajya Sabha Debate - News18
summary:
BJP Ended One Nation, Two Constitutions: JP Nadda On J&K During Rajya Sabha Debate

Last Updated: December 17, 2024, 18:02 IST

Union Minister JP Nadda addressed the Rajya Sabha, emphasizing that the BJP has ended the policy of one nation, two constitutions in Jammu and Kashmir. He criticized the Congress party, referencing issues like the emergency and Article 370.

  • JP Nadda stated, “We ended the one nation-two constitutions policy in J&K.”
  • He highlighted that significant laws passed by Parliament were not previously applicable in J&K.
  • Nadda called attention to past political figures and their roles in India's integration.
  • He challenged the Congress party regarding their handling of the Constitution and other political issues.

“This was due to restrictions and limitations posed by Article 370 of the Constitution,” Nadda explained.

The debate in Parliament continues to reflect on the historical significance of the Constitution, with further discussions planned in the coming days.
newTitle: BJP Ended One Nation, Two Constitutions: JP Nadda On J&K During Rajya Sabha Debate

title: Congress' "Two-Thirds Majority" Jab At BJP Over 'One Nation, One Poll' - NDTV
summary:
Congress Critiques BJP's 'One Nation, One Poll' Proposal Amid Voting Controversy

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Lok Sabha has passed two bills aimed at implementing 'one nation, one election', though critics point out that the ruling party failed to secure the necessary support.

  • The BJP's 'one nation, one election' strategy was discussed during a vote that passed two bills by a simple majority.
  • Critics, including Congress MPs, argue that the government lacks the two-thirds majority needed to amend the Constitution for simultaneous elections.
  • Prominent Congress figures like Manickam Tagore and Shashi Tharoor highlighted the shortcomings in support for the bill.
  • Opposition parties claim the amendments could undermine India’s federal structure and urge for immediate withdrawal of the proposal.
  • Despite the dissent, some BJP allies have expressed support for the ‘one nation, one election’ initiative.
“To pass it (bills to amend the Constitution) you need a 2/3 majority that they very clearly don't have.” — Shashi Tharoor

The controversy surrounding the voting process highlights significant divisions between the ruling and opposition parties, with implications for India's electoral future.
newTitle: Congress Critiques BJP's 'One Nation, One Poll' Proposal Amid Voting Controversy

NASA James Webb Space Telescope reveals rocky planet formation in harsh environments - The Times of India
summary:
NASA's James Webb Space Telescope Reveals Rocky Planet Formation in Harsh Environments

Published on: December 16, 2023, Source: The Astrophysical Journal

The recent findings from NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope reveal that planets can form and survive in environments that are much harsher than previously believed. This challenges long-held theories about planet formation.

  • James Webb Telescope findings suggest long-lasting planet-forming disks exist around stars with low heavy elements.
  • Planet-forming disks can survive for tens of millions of years, providing ample time for planets to form.
  • Research challenges traditional models that argue planets cannot form in metal-poor environments.
  • Implications extend to understanding planet formation in the early universe, potentially dating back to shortly after the Big Bang.
“This implies that planets could have begun forming at a much earlier stage in the universe’s history than previously thought.” - Guido De Marchi

The discovery revolutionizes our understanding of planet formation and opens new avenues for research in astronomy, particularly regarding the early universe and the origins of our solar system.
newTitle: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope Sheds Light on Planet Formation in Harsh Environments

title: Disgruntled Chhagan Bhujbal hits out at Ajit Pawar: ‘I am not a toy in anyone’s hand’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Disgruntled Chhagan Bhujbal hits out at Ajit Pawar: ‘I am not a toy in anyone’s hand’

Publication Date: Tuesday, December 12, 2024

Source: Indian Express

Senior NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal expressed his frustration after not being inducted into Maharashtra’s Cabinet, claiming that his opposition to Jarange-Patil led to his exclusion despite the Chief Minister’s support for his inclusion.

  • Bhujbal felt neglected by Ajit Pawar, voicing his concerns publicly.
  • He accused Ajit Pawar of controlling party decisions and hinting that he was excluded as punishment for his stance on Maratha rights.
  • Bhujbal plans to convene supporters in Nashik to discuss his future after feeling disregarded by the party leadership.
  • He expressed dissatisfaction about being treated as a mere pawn in political decisions.
  • Senior NCP leader Praful Patel affirmed Bhujbal's desire to join the Rajya Sabha but there were complications with candidate selections.
“I am not a toy in your hands who will follow blindly everything… Chhagan Bhujbal is not that kind of man.”

In conclusion, Bhujbal's statements highlight internal party conflicts and the challenges within the NCP as leaders navigate their political ambitions amid shifting alliances.
newTitle: Chhagan Bhujbal Criticizes Ajit Pawar Over Cabinet Exclusion

Rohit Sharma faced his fourth consecutive failure on Australian soil, struggling against Pat Cummins. His lack of confidence is evident, reflecting on his underwhelming batting and leadership.

  • He exhibited poor technique, pushing at deliveries without proper footwork.

title: OnePlus 13 series to make its debut on January 7 at the winter launch event - The Indian Express
summary:
OnePlus 13 series to make its debut on January 7 at the winter launch event

Publication Date: January 7, 2024 Source: Indian Express

On January 7, OnePlus will host a global launch event to unveil its new OnePlus 13 series, featuring the OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R, among possibly other products. The event will start at 9:30 PM IST and will be live-streamed on YouTube.

  • The OnePlus 13 will be powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chip.
  • The OnePlus 13R will utilize the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3, targeting performance-oriented users seeking affordability.
  • Both devices will likely come with the latest OxygenOS 15 update.
  • The OnePlus 13 will feature a 2K quad-curved display, while the 13R will have a 1.5K flat panel display.
  • Improved display technology to prevent green line issues is expected.
  • The OnePlus 13 will have an IP68/69 rating for water and dust resistance.
  • Both models are anticipated to support a 6,000 mAh battery with 100W fast charging.
  • The OnePlus 13 will also feature 50W wireless charging.
"These smartphones will also come with improved display technology, making them resilient against green line issues."

The upcoming OnePlus 13 series aims to offer advanced features while catering to both flagship and mid-range markets, highlighting OnePlus's commitment to innovation and user experience.

Three asteroids are on their way to Earth - India Today
summary:
Three Asteroids Approaching Earth Soon

Publication Date: November 2024   |   Source: India Today

On December 17, 2024, three asteroids will approach Earth, presenting unique scientific research opportunities. The asteroids include 2022 YO1, 2024 XR6, and 2024 XC17, all deemed non-threatening to the planet.

  • Asteroids 2022 YO1, 2024 XR6, and 2024 XC17 are set for close encounters with Earth.
  • 2022 YO1 will approach within 7,56,604 kilometers and measures 2.6–5.9 meters.
  • 2024 XR6, measuring 12–26 meters, will pass at about 15 million kilometers away.
  • 2024 XC17, measuring 9.1–20 meters, will come within 7.8 million kilometers.
  • All asteroids pose no threat to Earth and will provide research opportunities for astronomers.
Astronomers are tracking the asteroids with advanced systems to study their trajectories, sizes, and compositions, enhancing understanding of near-Earth dynamics.

The upcoming flybys of these asteroids present an excellent opportunity for scientific observation without endangering Earth.

Men Use Bat Poop To Grow Cannabis, Both Die Due To This Medical Condition - ABP Live
summary:
Men Use Bat Poop To Grow Cannabis, Both Die Due To This Medical Condition

Published at: 17 Dec 2024 01:33 PM (IST)

Source: Live Science

Two men in New York died from a rare fungal lung infection after using bat guano as fertilizer for their cannabis plants. They developed histoplasmosis, a dangerous condition caused by inhaling spores from bat droppings.

  • Both men were aged 59 and 64, with pre-existing health conditions.
  • They experienced symptoms such as fever, cough, significant weight loss, and respiratory failure.
  • Histoplasmosis is non-communicable between humans or pets.
  • The use of bat guano as fertilizer carries severe health risks.
  • 5-7% of hospitalized histoplasmosis patients may die from the infection.
“Their deaths should serve as a warning about the potential dangers of using bat guano as a fertilizer.”

This tragic incident highlights the need for awareness regarding unconventional agricultural practices and their unexpected health impacts.
newTitle: Men Die After Using Bat Guano to Fertilize Cannabis in New York

title: India vs Australia LIVE Score, 3rd Test, Day 4: Jasprit Bumrah, Akash Deep's Fightback Ends Australia's Follow-On Plan At Stumps - NDTV Sports

The fourth day of the ongoing third Test between India and Australia showcased a remarkable performance by Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep, allowing India to avoid following on. At stumps, India scored 252/9, trailing by 193 runs.

  • Pat Cummins took four wickets for Australia, with Mitchell Starc claiming three.
“AND THEY HAVE DONE IT!!!!! India have finally avoided the follow-on.”

The gripping contest on Day 4 ended with India poised to fight back further in the ongoing Test series, with their lower order showing impressive fight.
